p: As climate changes, either from natural processes and/or human activity, novel and disappeared climates will arise (Jackson & Overpeck, 2000; Williams & Jackson, 2007). Long‚Äêterm climate patterns that affect observed novel and disappeared climates, whether in the past, present, or future, arise not only from geographic and temporal changes in the environment, but also as a result of atmospheric and topographic processes that occur across many spatial scales (Ackerly et al., 2010).
